intro: Baeria aristosa, commonly known as the arrowleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its opposite, arrow-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive silvery underside. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and woodland areas. Baeria aristosa is part of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and some toxic species.
